title: @Riot - Low Volume of Skin releases...
body:
It seems that within the last few patches there have been limited number of skins. Challenger Nidalee alone, Ori+Sona, Kennen+Yasuo... Now, since Hextech Annie isn't going to ship with Hextech crafting, probably only Elderwood LB and MAYBE Annie for this next patch... 

Is there any particular reason for the low amount of skins being cranked out? It seems like last year it was a constant 3+ skins per patch. I'm not complaining too much, because Elderwood LB looks GREAT, but was just wondering if there was any certain reason?

replies.body:
Our goal isn't to make as many skins as possible just to say we made a skin for every champion, or pumped out x number of skins in a year. In fact, we don't have an exact number of skins we want/need to make.

Instead, we focus on what cool thematics we could create, and which champions would work well to be part of the thematic. 

We would rather create quality skins that make sense and are something you guys enjoy, rather than just putting out a skin to say x champion has a new skin 'cause they haven't had one in two years. 

So, we're looking to make more badass skins with cool particles and sounds and other bells and whistles, but that may mean a few less skins than the prior year.

I gotta say, amazing work on that Annie skin. when it is finally released all my gemstones are going towards it.  My only gripe with it is her eyes aren't glowing blue like the SA but im just nit-picking.
Glad you're a fan! I'd be happy to pass along your feedback. ^-^
Please do. the glowing eyes would be the icing on the cake. like what they did for cosmic reaver {{champion:38}}
I actually prefer having the least possible number of glowy eyes, because biology. I'm ok with Morde having glowy eyes - but not Panth or Volibear.

I'm honestly fine with this just as long as you balance the time in between champions getting skins. There are champions who haven't gotten a skin in 2+ years and there are some champions who have gotten 2 in less than a year.

We've been working to give champions who haven't had a skin in a while, but it does take time. Some champions we've hit in the last year who haven't had a skin in a long time were Fiora, Yi, Akali, Galio, and Kennen this year. 

Some champions, such as Yorick, aren't able to receive a skin until they receive an update, same as Taric. So, we have some limitations for some champions. 

That said, champions who have gone through the champion update - like Sion and  Poppy - are now able to get a skin and are on our radar.

We do keep track of the time since a champion last received a skin, as well as what they have in their existing skins catalog.

Keep in mind that we do have several teams, and each works on a different aspect of skins/champions.

 In the cases you've mentioned - Amumu and Jax would fall into Champion Update. They've currently got their hands full with the Mage Roster Update, Taric, as well as Yorick. They're definitely working hard to update a bunch of champions, but, we aren't able to do all of them at once. 

Also keep in mind that while patches may be light sometimes, it doesn't mean we don't have a lot of other content in the works.
